long_desc.thetext:
The component/testrunner/portable.json uses a job definition ("gen-css") that contains non-portable shell commands 'cat' and 'sed'. These tools are not available under Windows and introduce additional installation prerequisites for uses working on that platform. This violates our "Python-only" prerequisites effort; we should be careful not to violate it without dire need.
In that sense should the 'cat' and 'sed' commands be replaced by commands that are available cross-platform and don't extend our list of prerequisites. A tool/bin/cat.py has already been written for this purpose. The 'sed' command can probably be replaced by another suitable Python script, maybe in testrunner/tool if it is not generic enough.

The portable Test Runner is not intended to be generated by SDK users. It is a pre-built library like qx-oo that can be downloaded from qooxdoo.org.
I would rather move portable.json to some place where it won't be included in the SDK than invest any amount of time in making it cross-platform.

(In reply to comment #1) > The portable Test Runner is not intended to be generated by SDK users. It is a > pre-built library like qx-oo that can be downloaded from qooxdoo.org. > > I would rather move portable.json to some place where it won't be included in > the SDK than invest any amount of time in making it cross-platform.
Thats a good question. Is there really no need to someone to build that on its own, maybe with a slightly different configuration?

All right, you've convinced me. Replaced the sed command with a cross-platform Python script, tool/injectcss.py
